title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include an acceptable description. Acceptable descriptions include the following.

· A factor that becomes limiting would cause the population size to stabilize.

· Space/sunlight/herbivory/phosphorus/nitrogen/other density-dependent factor becomes limiting, and the population stabilizes.

The response includes an acceptable description. Acceptable descriptions include the following.

· A factor that becomes limiting would cause the population size to stabilize.

· Space/sunlight/herbivory/phosphorus/nitrogen/other density-dependent factor becomes limiting, and the population stabilizes.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not include an explanation that plot B is likely to be more resilient because plot B has much greater species diversity than plot A does.
The response includes an explanation that plot B is likely to be more resilient because plot B has much greater species diversity than plot A does.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not include a representation that shows all four species, including A. trifida, in the template provided.
The response includes a representation that shows all four species, including A. trifida, in the template provided.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include an acceptable explanation. Acceptable explanations include the following.

· There are no predators of the invasive species, so its population grows faster and reduces biodiversity.

· The invasive species germinates earlier, and uses up resources and reduces biodiversity.

· The invasive species outcompetes other species, and reduces biodiversity.

The response includes an acceptable explanation. Acceptable explanations include the following.

· There are no predators of the invasive species, so its population grows faster and reduces biodiversity.

· The invasive species germinates earlier, and uses up resources and reduces biodiversity.

· The invasive species outcompetes other species, and reduces biodiversity.
